body_html:
@fmassa Appreciate! You explanation is very clear!
BTW, so pytorch use += operator this way different from python own's? I try pure python again in same way like.

xx = 1
yy = xx
yy = yy + 1
print(xx)

mm = 1
zz = mm
zz += 1
print(mm)

the prints get both "1" for xx or mm.
Am I correct?

body:
@fmassa Appreciate! You explanation is very clear!
BTW, so pytorch use += operator this way different from python own's? I try pure python again in same way like.
```
xx = 1
yy = xx
yy = yy + 1
print(xx)

mm = 1
zz = mm
zz += 1
print(mm)
```
the prints get both "1" for xx or mm.
Am I correct?
